cab.content: This document is the property of His Britannic Majesty's Government.SECRET.cp. 3082a.i-1THE CABINET.INTERNMENT OF IRISH REBELS.MEMORANDUM BY THE SECRETARY OF STATE FOR WAR.With reference J to the last paragraph of my memorandum of 25th J une 79 (OP. 3082) on the above subject, I understand that in a case heard in the Court of Irish King's Bench on 27th June (application for a writ of habeas corpus ex parte Brady), 745 it was decided that Regulation 14b of the Restoration of Order in Ireland Regulations is intra vires, in so far as it purports to authorize action with regard to persons outside Ireland. If, therefore, the Cabinet decide to authorize internment of Irish rebels in this country, it will be possible to continue such internment under the Restoration of Order in Ireland Regulations after the statutory date of termination of the War without fresh legislation.L. W.-E.Uh July, 1921.
